newsitem.title: UK: Bowthorpe down after in-line figures.
newsitem.headline: Bowthorpe down after in-line figures.

text.p: Shares in Bowthorpe Plc fell 6p to 434-1/2p by 0740 GMT after the company reported first-half results in-line with market expectations.
"There was nothing terribly wrong with the figures but there was also nothing there to get excited about," one market maker said.
"On a day like today, with the market in bit of a gloomy mood, a bit of a markdown was inevitable. But there isn't much volume behind it," he added.
The electronics group said first-half pre-tax profits rose to 42.47 million stg from 39.64 million a year ago.
The dividend was increased to 3.21 pence per share versus 3.0 pence last time.
The company also said profits for the second half were likely to show a comparable rate of growth to the interim period.
Only 38,000 shares had traded by 0740 GMT.
